sentence.text: Edward 's attempts to manipulate seemed both touching and , eventually , fruitless .
His willingness to talk to the French people on their level was received as a touching gesture rather than a condescending one .
HERE 'S a rather touching letter to the troops from Captain Robert Maxwell , headed simply : Our Home .
The touching love letters they exchanged are testimony to that growing bond of affection .
He wrote me a touching letter of thanks .
Although Papillon has rousing and touching moments , the whole enterprise meanders on too heavily for too long .
The most touching moment of the ecstatic after-match celebrations was when Boro players presented their shirts to disabled fans .
There is a funny , touching reconciliation scene , and then Michael drops his bombshell .
She almost smiled as she imagined the touching scene .
A touching little scene ensued . "
` That 's a very touching story , but it 'll take a little more than that to convince me that you were n't heading for the exit . "
The dialogue and the songs are all in English , and they tell a touching and simple story .
It is necessary and immensely touching that your mentor should take the trouble to give you comfort in every step you take , in a very basic and everyday way .
Animation returned to Victoria 's features ; it was so touching when your children tried to make you cheerful with no conception of what was on your mind .
THERE was something particularly touching about the picture of murdered teenager Johanna Young that dominated newspaper front pages this week .
What is so touching about these poems is the contrast that they express .
Mrs Mentle and I both felt it was touching of Pugh to place a sticker in the back of the hearse which read ` Do n't follow me , follow Athletico Whaddon . "
However , I shall not be parting with Shelley either , whose touching sincerity and integrity of approach , allied to enviable technical command , brings its own considerable rewards .
Revealing a touching faith in the stability of money , Rothschild suggested that no interest would be due on the loan but that the capital would be repaid after forty years .
Mrs Pouncey 's introduction merits special mention for its touching account of her immensely rewarding marriage and her involvement in her husband 's career .
On the other , she betrays a touching credulity towards such mumbo-jumbo as antibiotics and Dolby sound .
A touching testament of comic Les Dawson 's love for his second wife Tracey is being broadcast on Sunday .
The care with which Christians had treasured their Bibles , prayer books and hymn books was very touching .
Her devotion to him was touching , but he still did n't love her .
The pride in the voice was touching , if self-congratulatory .
This touching but morbid In Memoriam served only to bring home to me the realisation of what now seemed inevitable .
Their support and messages of comfort were all the more touching and meant a great deal to the Orkney families .
